<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Board of Directors and Stockholders
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have audited Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc.&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control&#8212;Integrated Framework (2013 framework) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc.&#8217;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in the accompanying Management&#8217;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the entity&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk. Our audit also included performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	An entity&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. An entity&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the entity; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the entity are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the entity; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the entity&#8217;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial
</FONT>
	reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In our opinion, Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc. maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control&#8212;Integrated Framework (2013 framework)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	62
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the balance sheet and the related statements of operations, comprehensive loss, stockholders&#8217; equity, and cash flows of Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc., and our report dated February 24, 2017 expressed an unqualified opinion.

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Board of Directors and Stockholders
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have audited the accompanying balance sheet of Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc. as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the related statements of operations, comprehensive loss, stockholders&#8217; equity, and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December 31, 2016. These financial statements are the responsibility of the entity&#8217;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc. as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December 31, 2016, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc.&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control&#8212;Integrated Framework (2013 framework) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO), and our report dated February 24, 2017 expressed an unqualified opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	/s/ Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Wyomissing, Pennsylvania
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	February 24, 2017
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-1
</FONT>
</DIV>

	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.

<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z934080D35B824CCABAB439B11613AD94" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	1.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Operations and Organization
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 23.75PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 23.75PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (the &#8220;Company,&#8221;), a Delaware corporation, is a biopharmaceutical company whose principal operations are the discovery, development and commercialization of innovative treatments for cancer.&#160; The Company had an accumulated deficit of $
</FONT>
	115,024,209
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	at December 31, 2016 and anticipates incurring losses through fiscal year 2017 and beyond.&#160; The Company has not yet generated commercial revenues and has funded its operating losses to date through the sale of shares of its common stock and warrants to purchase shares of its common stock, convertible debt, financings, interest income from cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, and proceeds from reimbursed research and development costs.&#160; The Company believes that its cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities, will be sufficient to cover its cash flow requirements for its current activities at least for the next 12 months from the date these financial statements were issued.&#160; Management believes it has the capability of managing the Company&#8217;s operations within existing cash available by focusing on select research and development activities, selecting projects in conjunction with potential financings and milestones, and efficiently managing its general and administrative affairs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z5BA9309E2B904DEEBF41E7FEA99BADFD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	a) Cash and Cash Equivalents
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash and cash equivalents include cash on hand and short&#8209;term investments purchased with remaining maturities of three months or less at acquisition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	b) Marketable Securities
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Marketable securities are considered &#8220;available-for-sale&#8221; in accordance with Financial Statement Accounting Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) Accounting Standards Codification (&#8220;ASC&#8221;) 320, &#8220;Debt and Equity Securities&#8221;, and thus are reported at fair value in the Company&#8217;s accompanying balance sheet, with unrealized gains and losses excluded from earnings and reported as a separate component of stockholders&#8217; equity.&#160; Amounts reclassified out of accumulated other comprehensive loss into realized gains and losses are accounted for on the basis of specific identification and are included in other income or expense in the statement of operations.&#160; The Company classifies such investments as current on the balance sheet as the investments are readily marketable and available for use in the Company&#8217;s current operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -22.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 46.8PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	c) Equipment
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Equipment is stated at cost less accumulated depreciation. Depreciation, based on the lesser of the term of the lease or the estimated useful life of the assets, is provided as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z936639BBB8CD4D2C99F43A7D4B730BAE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER">

<U>
	&#160;Life

</TD>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 15%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	straight line
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 31%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	3-5 years
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 2%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-7
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV>

	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	d) Research and Development
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Research and development costs are expensed as incurred.&#160; Research and development expenses consist primarily of third party service costs under research and development agreements, salaries and related personnel costs, including stock-based compensation, costs to acquire pharmaceutical products and product rights for development and amounts paid to contract research organizations, hospitals and laboratories for the provision of services and materials for drug development and clinical trials.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Costs incurred in obtaining the licensing rights to technology in the research and development stage that have no alternative future uses and are for unapproved product compounds are expensed as incurred.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	e) Use of Estimates
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160; These estimates are based on management&#8217;s best knowledge of current events and actions the Company may undertake in the future.&#160; Actual results may ultimately differ from these estimates.&#160; These estimates are reviewed periodically and as adjustments become necessary, they are reported in earnings in the period in which they become available.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	f) Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The carrying amounts reported in the accompanying financial statements for cash and cash equivalents, prepaid expenses and other assets, and accounts payable and accrued expenses approximate fair value because of the short&#8209;term maturity of these financial instruments.&#160; The fair value of warrant liabilities is discussed in Note 12, the fair value of marketable securities and certain other assets and liabilities is discussed in Note 16.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-8
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage81"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV>
<A STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	g) Income Taxes
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with ASC 740, &#8220;Income Taxes&#8221;.&#160; Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recorded for differences between the financial statement and tax basis of the assets and liabilities that will result in taxable or deductible amounts in the future based on enacted tax laws and rates.&#160; ASC 740 requires that a valuation allowance be established when it is more likely than not that all portions of a deferred tax asset will not be realized.&#160; A review of all positive and negative evidence needs to be considered, including a company&#8217;s current and past performance, the market environment in which the company operates, length of carryback and carryforward periods and existing contracts that will result in future profits.&#160; Income tax expense is recorded for the amount of income tax payable or refundable for the period, increased or decreased by the change in deferred tax assets and liabilities during the period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of the Company&#8217;s significant cumulative losses, the Company determined that it was appropriate to establish a valuation allowance for the full amount of deferred tax assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The calculation of the Company&#8217;s tax liabilities involves the inherent uncertainty associated with the application of complex tax laws.&#160; The Company is subject to examination by various taxing authorities.&#160; The Company believes that, as a result of its loss carryforward sustained to date, any examination would result in a reduction of its net operating losses rather than a tax liability.&#160; As such, the Company has not provided for any additional taxes that would be estimated under ASC 740.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	h) Stock-Based Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In accordance with ASC 718, &#8220;Stock Compensation,&#8221; compensation costs related to share-based payment transactions, including employee stock options, are to be recognized in the financial statements. In addition, the Company adheres to the guidance set forth within Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) Staff Accounting Bulletin (&#8220;SAB&#8221;) No. 107, which provides the Staff&#8217;s views regarding the interaction between ASC 718 and certain SEC rules and regulations, and provides interpretations with respect to the valuation of share-based payments for public companies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i) Concentration of Credit Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ASC 825, &#8220;Financial Instruments,&#8221; requires disclosure of any significant off balance sheet risk and credit risk concentration.&#160; The Company does not have significant off&#8209;balance sheet risk or credit concentration.&#160; The Company maintains cash and cash equivalents with major financial institutions.&#160; From time to time the Company has funds on deposit with commercial banks that exceed federally insured limits.&#160; The balances are insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation up to $250,000. At December 31, 2016, the Company&#8217;s uninsured cash balance was $
</FONT>
	11,078,473
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	. Management does not consider this to be a significant credit risk as the banks are large, established financial institutions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	j) Reclassification
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Certain amounts in the prior year&#8217;s financial statements have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation with no material effect on the financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-9
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	k) Recent Accounting Pronouncements Affecting the Company
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In May 2014, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update (&#8220;ASU&#8221;) 2014-09, &#8220;Revenue from Contracts with Customers,&#8221; a comprehensive new revenue recognition standard that will supersede nearly all existing revenue recognition guidance under U.S. GAAP. The standard&#8217;s core principle is that a company should recognize revenue when it transfers goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the company expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods and services, and provides a revenue recognition framework in accordance with this principle.&#160; On August 12, 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-14, which defers the effective date of ASU 2014-09 by one year to December 15, 2017 for annual reporting periods beginning after that date and interim periods therein.&#160; Early adoption of the standard is permitted, but not before the original effective date of December 15, 2016.&#160; The Company is currently evaluating the impact that the adoption of this guidance will have on its financial statements and future operating results.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#8217;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In August 2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-15, &#8220;Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#8217;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern,&#8221; which requires management to perform interim and annual assessments as to the entity&#8217;s ability to continue as a going concern and provides related disclosure guidance.&#160; ASU 2014-15 is effective for reporting periods ending after December 15, 2016, with early adoption permitted. The Company adopted this pronouncement for the year ended December 31, 2016.&#160; This pronouncement did not have a material impact on its financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Leases
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, &#8220;Leases,&#8221; which requires an entity to recognize assets and liabilities arising from leases on the balance sheet and to provide additional disclosures about leasing arrangements.&#160; ASU 2016-02 will be effective for reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2018, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the impact the adoption of this guidance will have on its financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Compensation-Stock Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09, &#8220;Compensation-Stock Compensation: Improvements to Employee Share Based Payment Accounting,&#8221; which includes multiple provisions intended to simplify various aspects of accounting for share-based payments.&#160; The guidance is effective for reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016, with early adoption permitted.&#160; The Company is currently evaluating the impact the adoption of this guidance will have on its financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-10
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company typically invests in highly-rated securities, with the primary objective of minimizing the potential risk of principal loss.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, the Company had four investments of commercial paper with a fair value of $3,985,740 and unrealized losses of $1,684, and four corporate bonds with a fair value of $4,031,170 and unrealized losses of $4,635, all of which have been unrealized losses for less than 12 months.&#160; The Company does not intend to sell its marketable securities in an unrealized loss position.&#160; Based upon the Company&#8217;s securities&#8217; fair value relative to the cost, high ratings, and volatility of fair value, the Company considers the declines in market value of its marketable securities to be temporary in nature and does not consider any of its investments other-than-temporarily impaired, and anticipates that it will recover the entire amortized cost basis.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December 31, 2016, all of the Company&#8217;s marketable securities are expected to mature in less than one year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Deposits on contracts consist of deposits on research and development contracts for services that had not been incurred as of the balance sheet date.&#160; Prepaid expenses and other assets include prepaid general and administrative expenses, such as insurance, rent, investor relations fees and compensatory stock issued for services not yet incurred as of the balance sheet date.
</DIV>

<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z1E5C442E6EE14E5CAEEACAC55817C2A6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	7.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Deferred Research and Development Arrangements
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Rexgene Biotech Co., Ltd.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 24PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In 2003, the Company entered into a collaborative research agreement with Rexgene Biotech Co., Ltd. (&#8220;Rexgene&#8221;), a shareholder.&#160; Rexgene is engaged in the development of pharmaceutical products in Asia and has agreed to assist the Company with the research, development and clinical trials necessary for registration of the Company&#8217;s drug candidate Archexin in Asia.&#160; This agreement provides Rexgene with exclusive rights to license, sublicense, make, have made, use, sell and import Archexin in Asia.&#160; In accordance with the agreement, Rexgene paid the Company a one-time fee of $1,
</FONT>
	500,000
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in 2003.&#160; The agreement terminates at the later of 20 years or the term of the patent.&#160; The amortization reduces research and development expenses for the periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 24PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company is using 20 years as its basis for recognition and accordingly research and development expenses were reduced by
</FONT>
	$75,000
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	for each of the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014.&#160; The remaining $450
</FONT>
	,000
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	and $525,000 to be amortized at December 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, are reflected as a deferred research and development arrangement on the balance sheet.&#160; The payment from Rexgene is being used in the cooperative funding of the costs of development of Archexin. Royalties of 3% of net sales of licensed products will become payable by Rexgene to the Company on a quarterly basis once commercial sales of Archexin begin in Asia.&#160; The product is still under development and commercial sales in Asia are not expected to begin until at least 2018.&#160; Under the terms of the agreement, Rexgene does not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	pay royalties on the Company&#8217;s net sales outside of Asia.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 24PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, Ltd.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 24PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company previously had an arrangement with Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Limited (&#8220;Teva&#8221;) where Teva provided funds for the pre-clinical development of RX-3117.&#160; The proceeds received from Teva were recorded as restricted cash and as a deferred research and development arrangement on the balance sheet.&#160; Costs paid for the development of RX-3117 reduced the deferred research and development arrangement and therefore were not an expense in the Company&#8217;s statement of operations.&#160; During the year ended December 31, 2014, $1
</FONT>
	58,630
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	was reduced from deferred research and development arrangements.&#160; As of December 31, 2014, there were no proceeds remaining, and therefore, no deferred research and development liability relating to Teva.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-13
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Deferred Lease Incentive
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In accordance with the Company&#8217;s office lease agreement, as amended and further discussed in Note 15, the Company has been granted leasehold improvement allowances from the lessor to be used for the construction cost of improvements to the leased property, which included architectural and engineering fees, government agency plan check, permit and other fees, sales and use taxes, testing and inspection costs and telephone and data cabling and wiring in the premises.&#160; The Company accounted for the benefit of the leasehold improvement allowance as a reduction of rental expense over the term of the office lease.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Deferred Office Lease Expense
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 21.55PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The lease agreement, as amended, provided for an initial annual base rent with annual increases over the following six years.&#160; The Company recognizes rental expense on a straight-line basis over the term of the lease, which resulted in a deferred rent liability of $48,095 and $60,468 as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z0B75AD39D741409CA5953A463A9E712D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	9.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Net Loss per Common Share
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Basic loss per common share is computed by dividing net loss by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding for the period.&#160; Diluted loss per common share is computed by dividing net loss by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding, plus the number of common share equivalents that would be dilutive.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, there were stock options and warrants to acquire, in the aggregate, 71,427,262, 39,082,886
</FONT>
	, and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2
</FONT>
	4,606,677
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, respectively, that are potentially dilutive. However, diluted loss per share for all periods presented is the same as basic loss per share because the inclusion of common share equivalents would be anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following transactions occurred during the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 21.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Public Offerings
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 21.6PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	January 2014
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 21.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On January 21, 2014, the Company closed on a registered direct public offering of 19,047,620 shares of common stock and warrants to purchase up to 4,761,905 shares of common stock.&#160; The common stock and warrants were sold in units, consisting of a share of common stock and a warrant to purchase 0.25 shares of common stock, at a price of $1.05 per unit, and the warrants have an exercise price of $1.28 per share.&#160; The total gross proceeds of the offering were $20,000,001.&#160; The warrants issued became exercisable beginning six months and one day after the closing date, will remain exercisable until the five-year anniversary of the closing date, and were recorded as liabilities at fair value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	On November 12, 2015, the Company closed on a registered direct public offering of 16,666,667 shares of common stock and warrants to purchase up to 12,500,000 shares of common stock.&#160; The common stock and warrants were sold in units, consisting of a share of common stock and a warrant to purchase 0.75 shares of common stock, at a price of $0.42 per unit, and the warrants have an exercise price of $0.53 per share.&#160; The total gross proceeds of the offering were $7,000,000.&#160; The warrants issued became exercisable beginning six months after the closing date, will remain exercisable until the five-year anniversary of the initial exercise date, and were recorded as liabilities at fair value.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On March 2, 2016, the Company closed on a registered direct public offering of 15,625,000 shares of common stock and warrants to purchase up to 11,718,750 shares of common stock.&#160; The common stock and warrants were sold in units, consisting of a share of common stock and a warrant to purchase 0.75 shares of common stock, at a price of $0.
</FONT>
	32
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	per unit, with an exercise price for the warrants of $0.
</FONT>
	42 per share
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.&#160; The total gross proceeds of the offering were $5,000,000.&#160; The issued warrants issued became exercisable beginning six months after the closing date, will remain exercisable until the five-year anniversary of the initial exercise date, and were recorded as liabilities at fair value.
</FONT>
</DIV>

	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At Market Offering
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 21.6PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On March 16, 2015, the Company entered into an at market issuance sales agreement (the &#8220;Sales Agreement&#8221;) with MLV &amp; Co. LLC (&#8220;MLV&#8221;) pursuant to which the Company may issue and sell shares of its common stock having an aggregate offering price of up to $40 million from time to time, at its option, through MLV as its sales agent, subject to certain terms and conditions. Any shares sold will be sold pursuant to the Company&#8217;s effective shelf registration statement on Form S-3 (File No. 333-196255), as supplemented by a prospectus supplement dated March 16, 2015.&#160; The Company will pay MLV a commission of 3.0% of the gross proceeds of the sale of any shares sold through MLV. For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company sold 1,407,072 shares of common stock pursuant to the Sales Agreement for $1,042,573 in gross proceeds at a weighted average price of $0.7410 per share.&#160; Net proceeds to the Company were $1,005,715 after deducting commissions and other transaction costs.&#160; Pursuant to the securities purchase agreement entered into in connection with the Company&#8217;s registered direct offering that closed on September 19, 2016, the Company is prohibited from selling any additional shares under the Sales Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.55PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZD890D275082E42F39477802096C6575F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	11.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Stock-Based Compensation
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December 31, 2016, the Company had 16
</FONT>
	,900,415
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	options outstanding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At the Company&#8217;s Annual Meeting of the Stockholders held on June 10, 2013, the Company&#8217;s stockholders voted to approve the Rexahn Pharmaceuticals, Inc. 2013 Stock Option Plan (the &#8220;2013 Plan&#8221;).&#160; Under the 2013 Plan, the Company grants stock options to key employees, directors and consultants of the Company.&#160; A total of 17,000,000 shares of common stock have been reserved for issuance pursuant to the 2013 Plan.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, there were 12,461,915 options outstanding under the 2013 Plan, and 4,530,585 shares were available for issuance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On August 5, 2003, the Company established a stock option plan (the &#8220;2003 Plan&#8221;).&#160; Under the 2003 Plan, the Company granted stock options to key employees, directors and consultants of the Company.&#160; With the adoption of the 2013 Plan, no new stock options may be issued under the 2003 Plan, but previously issued options under the 2003 Plan remain outstanding until their expiration.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, there were 4,318,500 outstanding options under the 2003 Plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In March 2016, the Company granted to a third party an option to purchase up to 120,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock.&#160; Of the Company&#8217;s outstanding options as of December 31, 2016, these were the only options that were not issued pursuant to the 2013 Plan or the 2003 Plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At the Company&#8217;s Annual Meeting of the Stockholders held on June 9, 2016, the Company&#8217;s stockholders voted to approve an amendment to the 2013 Plan, including to provide for awards of restricted stock and restricted stock units.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, no awards of restricted stock or restricted stock units had been granted
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the majority of the grants to employees, the vesting period is either i) 30%
</FONT>
	,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	30% and 40% on the first, second and third anniversaries, of the grant date, respectively, or ii) 25% each on the first four anniversaries.&#160; Options expire between five and ten years from the date of grant. For grants to non-employee consultants of the Company, the vesting period is between one and three years, subject to the fulfillment of certain conditions in the individual stock agreements, or 100% upon the occurrence of certain events specified in the individual stock agreements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	REXAHN PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Summary of Stock Option Transactions
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	There were 5,926,391 stock options granted at exercise prices ranging from $0.
</FONT>
	18
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to $0.37 with an aggregate fair value of $1,
</FONT>
	156,273
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	during the year ended December 31, 2016.&#160; There were 4,201,316 stock options granted at exercise prices ranging from $0.
</FONT>
	54
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to $0.89 with an aggregate fair value of $1,
</FONT>
	994,893
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	during the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; There were 2,528,499 stock options granted at exercise prices ranging from $0.
</FONT>
	68
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to $1.35 with an aggregate fair value of $1,
</FONT>
	737,087
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	during the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The fair value of options at the date of grant was estimated using the Black-Scholes option pricing model.&#160; The Company took into consideration guidance under ASC 718, &#8220;Compensation-Stock Compensation&#8221; and Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 107 (&#8220;SAB 107&#8221;) when reviewing and updating assumptions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Significant assumptions are determined as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Expected Term
</U>
</FONT>
	-the expected term was estimated using the simplified method whereby the expected term equals the arithmetic average of the vesting term and the original contractual term of the option.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Volatility
</U>
</FONT>
	-historical trading volatility of the Company&#8217;s stock on the date of grant for a period consistent with the expected term.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Risk-Free Interest Rate
</U>
</FONT>
	-the risk-free interest rate is based on the zero-coupon U.S. Treasury instruments on the date of grant with a maturity date consistent with the expected term of the Company&#8217;s stock option grants.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Expected Dividend
</U>
</FONT>
	-to date, the Company has not declared or paid any cash dividends and do not have any plans to do so in the future. Therefore, the Company used an expected dividend yield of zero.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The assumptions made in calculating the fair values of options are as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December 31, 2016 the weighted average remaining contractual life of the outstanding warrants was 4.
</FONT>
	3
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The warrants issued to investors in the December 2012, November 2015, March 2016, September 2016, and previous offerings contain a provision for net cash settlement in the event that there is a fundamental transaction (contractually defined as a merger, sale of substantially all assets, tender offer or share exchange).&#160; If a fundamental transaction occurs in which the consideration issued consists principally of cash or stock in a non-public company, then the warrant holder has the option to receive cash, equal to the fair value of the remaining unexercised portion of the warrant.&#160; Due to this contingent redemption provision, the warrants require liability classification in accordance with ASC 480 and are recorded at fair value.&#160; The warrants issued to investors in the July 2013, October 2013 and January 2014 offerings contain a fundamental transaction provision, but the warrant holders only have an option as to the type of consideration received if the holders of common stock receive an option as to their consideration.&#160; In addition, the warrants issued in the December 2012, July 2013, October 2013, January 2014, November 2015, March 2016, September 2016 and previous offerings contain a cashless exercise provision that is exercisable only in the event that a registration statement is not effective. That provision may not be operative if an effective registration statement is not available because an exemption under the U.S. securities laws may not be available to issue unregistered shares.&#160; As a result, net cash settlement may be required, and the warrants require liability classification.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ASC 820 provides requirements for disclosure of liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis in periods subsequent to the initial recognition.&#160; Fair values for warrants were determined using the Binomial Lattice (&#8220;Lattice&#8221;) valuation technique. The Lattice model provides for dynamic assumptions regarding volatility and risk-free interest rates within the total period to maturity. Accordingly, within the contractual term, the Company provided multiple date intervals over which multiple volatilities and risk free interest rates were used. These intervals allow the Lattice model to project outcomes along specific paths that consider volatilities and risk free rates that would be more likely in an early exercise scenario.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-21
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&#8212;Published trading market values;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Exercise price
</U>
</FONT>
	&#8212;Stated exercise price;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Term
</U>
</FONT>
	&#8212;Remaining contractual term of the warrant;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Volatility
</U>
</FONT>
	&#8212;Historical trading volatility for periods consistent with the remaining terms; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Risk-free rate
</U>
</FONT>
	&#8212;Yields on zero coupon government securities with remaining terms consistent with the remaining terms of the warrants.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Due to the fundamental transaction provision, which could provide for early redemption of the warrants, the model also considered the probability the Company would enter into a fundamental transaction during the remaining term of the warrant. Because the Company is not yet achieving positive cash flow, management believes the probability of a fundamental transaction occurring over the term of the warrant is unlikely and therefore estimates the probability of entering into a fundamental transaction to be 5%.&#160; For valuation purposes, the Company also assumed that if such a transaction did occur, it was more likely to occur towards the end of the term of the warrants.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The significant unobservable inputs used in the fair value measurement of the warrants include management&#8217;s estimate of the probability that a fundamental transaction may occur in the future.&#160; Significant increases (decreases) in the probability of occurrence would result in a significantly higher (lower) fair value measurement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following table summarizes the fair value of the warrants as of the respective balance sheet dates:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z161FCEBDB9C245308473EB032A735EAD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	13.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Mediation Settlement
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In connection with the process of seeking patent protection for Supinoxin in Japan, the Company had filed a patent application including claims covering Supinoxin with the Japanese Patent Office (&#8220;JPO&#8221;) for examination. The JPO initially agreed that the claims covering the compound for Supinoxin were allowable, but as a result of a mistake in the patent application filing as prepared and submitted by the Company&#8217;s Japanese patent attorney and incomplete review by the JPO&#8217;s patent examiner, the JPO issued a decision to grant a patent with claims that did not include Supinoxin&#8217;s chemical structure. The Company appealed this decision with the JPO to request withdrawal of the decision to grant so that the correct claims would be allowed, but the JPO refused to withdraw its decision. As a result, and in accordance with Japanese law and procedure for appealing patent application decisions, the Company has filed a lawsuit against the JPO in Tokyo District Court to cause the JPO to reverse its decision to grant the errant patent and to allow a patent that includes claims covering Supinoxin.&#160; The patent application at issue remains pending subject to the outcome of this action. While the composition of matter patent on Supinoxin structure remains pending in Japan, the Company either has already or will have protection in Japan from its issued and pending patents on formulation, method of use, and method of manufacturing as well as from market exclusivity period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 19, 2016, the Company entered into a binding settlement arrangement with the Company&#8217;s Japanese patent attorney in which the Japanese patent attorney agreed to pay a one-time settlement JPY 210,000,000, or $1,770,658, in exchange for the Company agreeing not to bring any future claims on account of this patent filing.&#160; The settlement payment was received by the Company by December 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	F-24
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	14.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Income Taxes
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	No provision for federal and state income taxes was required for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 due to the Company&#8217;s operating losses and increased deferred tax asset valuation allowance.&#160; At December 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company had unused net operating loss carry-forwards of approximately $111,605,000 and $98,954,000, respectively, which expire at various dates through 203
</FONT>
	6
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.&#160; Some of this amount may be subject to annual limitations under certain provisions of the Internal Revenue Code related to &#8220;changes in ownership.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December 31, 2016 and 2015, the deferred tax assets related to the aforementioned carry-forwards have been fully offset by valuation allowances, because significant utilization of such amounts is not presently expected in the foreseeable future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Deferred tax assets and valuation allowances consist of:

<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZE4EE3BDBCA2D42D49A1D289DC3C032F7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	15.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Commitments and Contingencies
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZF2D1ABEFF24A499CBACA3C9583905EB1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has contracted with various vendors for research and development services, the terms which require payments over the term of the agreements, usually ranging from two to 36 months. The costs to be incurred are estimated and are subject to revision. As of December 31, 2016, the total estimated cost to complete these agreements was approximately $
</FONT>
	4,960,000
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	All of these agreements may be terminated by either party upon appropriate notice as stipulated in the respective agreements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZC76C19162843437E83CBC7B3463E1179" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On June 22, 2009, the Company entered into a License Agreement with Korea Research Institute of Chemical Technology (&#8220;KRICT&#8221;) to acquire the rights to all intellectual property related to quinoxaline-piperazine derivatives that were synthesized under a Joint Research Agreement.&#160; The initial license fee was $100,000, all of which was paid as of December 31, 2009.&#160; The agreement with KRICT calls for a one-time milestone payment of $1,000,000 within 30 days after the first achievement of marketing approval of the first commercial product arising out of or in connection with the use of KRICT&#8217;s intellectual properties.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, the milestone has not occurred.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z230AF35949D74D7DB9DF2A291C308831" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Office Space Lease
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On June 7, 2013, the Company signed the first amendment to its commercial lease agreement for 5,466 square feet of office space in Rockville, Maryland.&#160; Under the lease agreement, the Company pays its allocable portion of real estate taxes and common area operating charges.
</DIV>

	On July 26, 2014 the Company entered into the second amendment to the lease agreement.&#160; According to the terms of this amendment, the Company leased an additional 1,637 square feet of office space, beginning on September 1, 2014 and ending on August 31, 2015.&#160; The Company subsequently renewed the lease for this space for additional one-year terms, beginning on September 1, 2015 and 2016.

<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z1E55EAB85790408CB43FD714336CCC43" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	d)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has established a 401(k) plan for its employees.&#160; The Company has elected to match 100% of the first 3% of an employee&#8217;s compensation plus 50% of an additional 2% of the employee&#8217;s deferral. Expense related to this matching contribution aggregated to $113,204, $121,519 and $91,241 for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 respectively.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="Z28A08391DBCE49BC9D8FDDFAEBAC4A23" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	e)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In July 2013, the Company entered into an exclusive license agreement with the University of Maryland, Baltimore for a novel drug delivery platform, Nano-Polymer Drug Conjugate Systems.&#160; RX-21101 is the Company&#8217;s first drug candidate utilizing this platform.&#160; The agreement requires the Company to make payments to the University of Maryland if RX-21101 or any products from the licensed delivery platform achieve development milestones.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, no development milestones have occurred.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="ZAC7454C99D984C3CA778065A1C13AB9F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>

	f)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In October 2013, the Company signed an exclusive license agreement with the Ohio State Innovation Foundation, for a novel oligonucleotide drug delivery platform, Lipid-Coated Albumin Nanoparticle.&#160; The agreement requires the Company to make payments to the Ohio State Innovation Foundation or any products from the licensed delivery platform achieve development milestones.&#160; As of December 31, 2016, no development milestones have occurred.
</DIV>
</TD>

</A>
